meanings.definition: The quality or state of being hydrophobic.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophobicities of the material make it resistant to water.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the hydrophobicities of different substances to understand their behavior in water.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophobicities of the umbrella kept the raindrops at bay, making it a perfect choice for the stormy weather.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of water was so strong, it was like the hydrophobicities of a desert landscape.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophobicities of the oil on the surface of the pond created a mesmerizing pattern.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a molecule to repel water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophobicities of the soap molecules make them float on water.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophobicities of the wax cause water droplets to bead up on the surface.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophobicities of the rubber duck made it the champion of the bathtub race.
meanings.sent4: Her reluctance to swim was like the hydrophobicities of a duck's feathers.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophobicities of the leaf allowed it to repel water effortlessly.

meanings.definition: The measure of how strongly a substance repels water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophobicities of the fabric were tested by observing how quickly it dried after being soaked.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophobicities of the coating on the car prevented water from sticking to its surface.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophobicities of the cat's fur made bath time a hilarious struggle.
meanings.sent4: The hydrophobicities of the repellent spray were so effective, not a drop of water touched the surface.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophobicities of the lotus leaf inspired engineers to create self-cleaning materials.
